group_1.textLeft: Hmmmm...

group_1.textRight: I won't understand what you came to consult@me about if you continue groaning.

group_1.textLeft: Well, I've been tracking Sakurako for the past@week or so, and...
...Is it possible for Uwasa to become@emotionally attached to people?

group_1.textRight: By emotional attachment, do you mean in the@sense one might feel towards a pet?

group_1.textLeft: That's right.
You remember how Sakurako went to Sankyo@for the cherry blossom viewing spot?

group_1.textRight: Of course

group_1.textLeft: Well, I was reporting on the whole thing.
It was kinda interesting to see the kinds of@bonds that develop under the cherry blossoms.
Then, it occurred to me...
Isn't it really unusual for Sakurako to open up@to people so much?

group_1.textRight: By that logic, I'm sure she's emotionally attached@to all the other girls as well.

group_1.textLeft: We're Magical Girls, but these are ordinary@people we're talking about here.
Well, I guess it'd be easier to understand if@you take a look.

group_1.textRight: So you're in the Newspaper Club at school.

group_1.textLeft: | I'm said to be the newspaper's mascot, and@have a popular column. |

group_1.textRight: Oh my, that sounds like a big deal.
*Cough* *Cough*

group_1.textLeft: | Grandfather, are you feeling ill? |

group_1.textRight: No, it's just some tea stuck in my throat.
You need to drink it slowly.

group_1.textLeft: | Touka knows a lot about the human body,@so I'll ask her if there's anything to ask. |
By the way, how is the blossoming practice@going?

group_1.textRight: That's right, did you make it?

group_1.textLeft: | ...I forgot about it. |

group_1.textRight: [chara:801500:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Huh?!

group_1.textLeft: | I was more interested in speaking to@Grandfather and Grandmother. |
That's all, what do you think? I'm starting to@get a little worried...

group_1.textRight: To be honest, I'm not sure either.

group_1.textLeft: Is it unnatural for her to get attached to@ordinary people?

group_1.textRight: I can't tell what's natural or not for her.
As long as it doesn't go against the contents of@her [textBlue:Rumor], it's within the scope of her behavior.
Her original purpose changed, and her@priorities have shifted.
It doesn't mean there's any difference from the@original story that Iroha and I created.

group_1.textLeft: The rest of the story is blank, so Uwasa have@the freedom to do what they want?

group_1.textRight: That's right.

group_1.textLeft: I see...
Robots wouldn't try to do anything outside@their programming, but...
Uwasa are free to do whatever they want@outside of it.

group_1.textRight: And unlike other Uwasa, Sakurako is connected@to a server.
We don't know what she'll be interested in or@how much she can change.

group_1.textLeft: Is there anything we should be paying@attention to?

group_1.textRight: Well, this is just my hypothesis, but...
If I had to guess, I'd say "change"...

group_1.textLeft: Change...?

group_1.textRight: Uwasa strictly follow their [textBlue:Rumor]. They aren't@good at coping with changes in circumstances.
Even if it's something as trivial as a change@in the location of an object.
Or perhaps even a change in temperature.
That's why, if there are additional factors in@Sakurako's life she wishes to remain constant...
Things could become a little tricky.

group_1.textLeft: Factors that Sakurako wants to remain@constant right now...
